CARDINAL . NORP In order to assess the real value of the land , the court ordered on - site inspections and expert reports . Primarily , the experts worked on the classification of the plots since the value of urbanised land ( arsa ) was higher than rural land ( arazi ) . In this context , the experts observed that the plots were not reserved for habitation under any urban plan ( imar planı ) of the GPE or ORG ; they were not situated within residential areas ; and there was no annotation in the land registry that these plots were to be used for tourism purposes . Instead , the plots were classified as “ fields ” in ORG . As a result of the on - site inspections and their findings , the experts decided that the plots should be classified as rural land . They therefore calculated the value of the plots on that basis .

CARDINAL . In their written submissions the applicants contested the expert reports . They submitted an expert report dated DATE which concluded that the land in question should have been considered urbanised .
CARDINAL . After taking into consideration CARDINAL expert reports for each case , ORG of First - instance rejected the ORG objections in respect of the nature of the land .
